perturbation.original_text: On2 will use commercially reasonable efforts to cooperate with Wildform as necessary in completing the Development Work and delivery of the Deliverables. Upon receipt of each Deliverable, On2 shall have a period of thirty (30) working days within which to inspect such Deliverable based upon the relevant Specification (an "Acceptance Period"). Should On2 find that any Deliverable does not substantially conform to the relevant Specification, On2 shall promptly so notify Wildform in writing, which notice shall provide sufficiently detailed explanation of the non-conformities so as to allow Wildform to reproduce them (any such notice is referred to herein as a "Nonconformance Notice"). Each of the Deliverables shall be deemed accepted by On2 unless On2 delivers to Wildform a Nonconformance Notice within thirty (30) business days of the delivery of such Deliverable.
perturbation.changed_text: On2 will use commercially reasonable efforts to cooperate with Wildform as necessary in completing the Development Work and delivery of the Deliverables. Upon receipt of each Deliverable, On2 shall have a period of ten (10) working days within which to inspect such Deliverable based upon the relevant Specification (an "Acceptance Period"). Should On2 find that any Deliverable does not substantially conform to the relevant Specification, On2 shall promptly so notify Wildform in writing, which notice shall provide sufficiently detailed explanation of the non-conformities so as to allow Wildform to reproduce them (any such notice is referred to herein as a "Nonconformance Notice"). Each of the Deliverables shall be deemed accepted by On2 unless On2 delivers to Wildform a Nonconformance Notice within ten (10) business days of the delivery of such Deliverable.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the acceptance period from 30 to 10 days may be considered an unreasonably short time frame, especially for complex software deliverables. This could be deemed unconscionable or a breach of good faith depending on the specifics of the deliverables and applicable state law regarding contract interpretation and fairness.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of Good Faith and Fair Dealing (potentially violates implied contractual duties depending on jurisdiction).

perturbation.original_text:
During the first twelve (12) months of the Term, Wildform shall use commercially reasonable efforts to correct Program Errors within the response times set forth below. For purposes of the response times set forth below a "Serious" Program Error shall be defined as a Program Error that (a) causes the Deliverables to crash (malfunction), or (b) substantially degrades the performance, usability or appearance of the Deliverables. A "Minor" Program Error shall be defined as a bug that causes a less than substantial degradation in the performance, usability or appearance of the Deliverables.

Program Error        Response                           Correction
-------------        --------                           ----------

Serious              Within 1 business day              Within 8 business days

Minor                Within 4 business days             Within 15 business days
perturbation.changed_text:
During the first twelve (12) months of the Term, Wildform shall use commercially reasonable efforts to correct Program Errors; however, correction times are not guaranteed. For purposes of the response times set forth below a "Serious" Program Error shall be defined as a Program Error that (a) causes the Deliverables to crash (malfunction), or (b) substantially degrades the performance, usability or appearance of the Deliverables. A "Minor" Program Error shall be defined as a bug that causes a less than substantial degradation in the performance, usability or appearance of the Deliverables.

Program Error        Response                           Correction
-------------        --------                           ----------

Serious              Within 5 business days              Within 30 business days

Minor                Within 10 business days             Within 60 business days
perturbation.explanation: Altering the response and correction times for program errors to be significantly longer (serious errors now take 30 days instead of 8, minor errors now take 60 days instead of 15). This could be considered a breach of contract or a failure to provide adequate support, especially if industry standards dictate faster resolution times or the delay causes significant business disruption to On2. It also makes correction times not guaranteed, thus rendering Wildform blameless regardless of whether or not they are actually providing commercially reasonable efforts to correct Program Errors.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of Contract, Failure to Provide Adequate Support (potential violation of contract law depending on the specific circumstances and industry standards).

perturbation.original_text: Either of Wildform or On2 may terminate this Agreement if the other Party is in material breach of this Agreement and fails to cure such breach within thirty (30) days after written notice.
perturbation.changed_text: Either of Wildform or On2 may terminate this Agreement if the other Party is in material breach of this Agreement and fails to cure such breach within ten (10) days after written notice.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the cure period for a material breach of contract from 30 days to 10 days could be considered unreasonably short, depending on the nature of the breach and the efforts required to remedy it. This could be deemed unconscionable or a violation of the implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing under New York law, as it may not provide the breaching party with a reasonable opportunity to rectify the issue.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Good Faith and Fair Dealing (potentially violates implied contractual duties depending on jurisdiction).
